Description: Cylinder jar of marl pottery, exterior coated with a smoothed slip, which varies in colour from cream to pale brown. The jar narrows slightly from the base to the neck and has an external roll-rim. The neck bears an incised line of decoration below the rim.
Curator's comments: Cemetery H at Hiw was Late Predynastic to First Dynasty in date. See W. M. F. Petrie, 'Diospolis Parva : the cemeteries of Abadiyeh and Hu, 1898-9' (London, 1901). Wavy handle ware W85 in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
